intro: Saussurea igoschinae, commonly known as the Tibetan saffron, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It is characterized by its tall, branched stems and dense clusters of yellow to orange flower heads. The plant belongs to the family Asteraceae and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional Tibetan medicine. Its flowers are used to produce a yellow dye and are also valued for their potential therapeutic uses. Saussurea igoschinae thrives in cold, arid environments and is often found at elevations above 3,000 meters.
